lines.baseText: Shock brings ruin and terrified gazing around. Going ahead brings misfortune. If it has not yet reached one's own body but has reached one's neighbor first, there is no blame. One's comrades have something to talk about.
lines.changingText: The danger is extreme. Stay still and learn from the misfortunes of others.

hexagrams.name: Keeping Still, Mountain (Gen)
hexagrams.judgment: Keeping Still. Keeping his back still so that he no longer feels his body. He goes into the courtyard and does not see his people. No blame.
hexagrams.image: Mountains standing close together: The image of Keeping Still. Thus the superior man does not permit his thoughts to go beyond his situation.

lines.baseText: Keeping his toes still. No blame. Continued perseverance furthers.
lines.changingText: Calculated inaction at the start avoids mistakes. Look before you leap.

lines.baseText: Keeping his calves still. He cannot rescue him whom he follows. His heart is not glad.
lines.changingText: You are forced to stop by circumstances or superiors. Accept it despite the frustration.

lines.baseText: Keeping his hips still. Making his sacrum stiff. Dangerous. The heart suffocates.
lines.changingText: Forced stillness causes tension. Relaxation is needed to avoid injury.

lines.baseText: Keeping his trunk still. No blame.
lines.changingText: Stillness in the center brings peace and stability.

lines.baseText: Keeping his jaws still. The words have order. Remorse disappears.
lines.changingText: Careful speech prevents regret. Silence is often golden.

lines.baseText: Noblehearted keeping still. Good fortune.
lines.changingText: Complete stillness and inner peace bring the highest good fortune.

hexagrams.name: Development (Gradual Progress) (Jian)
hexagrams.judgment: Development. The maiden is given in marriage. Good fortune. Perseverance furthers.
hexagrams.image: On the mountain, a tree: The image of Development. Thus the superior man abides in dignity and virtue, in order to improve the mores.

lines.baseText: The wild goose gradually draws near the shore. The young son is in danger. There is talk. No blame.
lines.changingText: A tentative start. Criticism may arise, but ignore it and proceed carefully.

lines.baseText: The wild goose gradually draws near the cliff. Eating and drinking in peace and concord. Good fortune.
lines.changingText: You have reached a safe place. Enjoy the security and ample provision.

lines.baseText: The wild goose gradually draws near the plateau. The man goes forth and does not return. The woman carries a child but does not bring it forth. Misfortune. It furthers one to fight off robbers.
lines.changingText: Progress stalls. Relationships or projects may fail. Protect what is yours.

lines.baseText: The wild goose gradually draws near the tree. Perhaps it will find a flat branch. No blame.
lines.changingText: You find a resting place, though it may not be perfect. It is safe for now.

lines.baseText: The wild goose gradually draws near the summit. For three years the woman has no child. In the end nothing can hinder her. Good fortune.
lines.changingText: Delays and misunderstandings separate you from your goal. Perseverance leads to reunion.

lines.baseText: The wild goose gradually draws near the cloud heights. Its feathers can be used for the sacred dance. Good fortune.
lines.changingText: Your success transcends personal gain and serves as an inspiration to others.

hexagrams.name: The Marrying Maiden (Gui Mei)
hexagrams.judgment: The Marrying Maiden. Undertakings bring misfortune. Nothing that would further.
hexagrams.image: Thunder over the lake: The image of The Marrying Maiden. Thus the superior man understands the transitory in the light of the eternity of the end.

lines.baseText: The marrying maiden as a concubine. A lame man who is able to tread. Undertakings bring good fortune.
lines.changingText: Accept a secondary position if it allows you to be useful. Humility brings success.

lines.baseText: A one-eyed man who is able to see. The perseverance of a solitary man furthers.
lines.changingText: Loyalty to one's duty, even in isolation or with limited vision, is honorable.

lines.baseText: The marrying maiden as a slave. She marries as a concubine.
lines.changingText: Your position is low and your options are few. Accept the situation for now.

lines.baseText: The marrying maiden draws out the allotted time. A late marriage comes in due course.
lines.changingText: Waiting for the right opportunity is better than rushing into a bad one.

lines.baseText: The sovereign I gives his daughter in marriage. The embroidered garments of the princess are not as gorgeous as those of the servingmaid. The moon that is nearly full brings good fortune.
lines.changingText: True worth is inner, not outer. Modesty in high station brings blessings.

lines.baseText: The woman holds the basket, but there are no fruits in it. The man stabs the sheep, but no blood flows. Nothing that would further.
lines.changingText: Empty forms without substance. The relationship or project is barren.

hexagrams.name: Abundance (Feng)
hexagrams.judgment: Abundance has success. The king attains abundance. Be not sad. Be like the sun at midday.
hexagrams.image: Both thunder and lightning come: The image of Abundance. Thus the superior man decides lawsuits and carries out punishments.

lines.baseText: When a man meets his destined ruler, they can be together ten days, and it is not a mistake. Going meets with recognition.
lines.changingText: A time of peak opportunity. Seize the moment and connect with those who can help.

lines.baseText: The curtain is of such fullness that the polestars can be seen at noon. Through going one meets with doubt and hate. If one rouses him through truth, good fortune comes.
lines.changingText: Your brilliance is obscured by circumstances. Trust in truth to clear the air.

lines.baseText: The underbrush is of such abundance that the small stars can be seen at noon. He breaks his right arm. No blame.
lines.changingText: Obstacles prevent you from acting effectively. Accept the temporary limitation.

lines.baseText: The curtain is of such fullness that the polestars can be seen at noon. He meets his ruler, who is of like kind. Good fortune.
lines.changingText: Darkness begins to life. You find a kindred spirit who understands you.

lines.baseText: Lines are coming, blessings and fame draw near. Good fortune.
lines.changingText: The time of abundance is here. Success, fame, and blessings arrive.

lines.baseText: He has abundance in his house. He screens off his family. He peers through the gate and no longer perceives anyone. For three years he sees nothing. Misfortune.
lines.changingText: Arrogance and isolation lead to downfall. Share your abundance or lose it.

hexagrams.name: The Wanderer (Lu)
hexagrams.judgment: The Wanderer. Success through smallness. Perseverance brings good fortune to the wanderer.
hexagrams.image: Fire on the mountain: The image of The Wanderer. Thus the superior man is clear-minded and cautious in imposing penalties, and protracts no lawsuits.

lines.baseText: If the wanderer busies himself with trivial things, he draws down misfortune upon himself.
lines.changingText: Do not get distracted by petty details. Keep your main goal in mind.

lines.baseText: The wanderer comes to an inn. He has his property with him. He wins the steadfastness of a young servant.
lines.changingText: You find a safe resting place and reliable help. Use this respite wisely.

lines.baseText: The wanderer's inn burns down. He loses the steadfastness of his young servant. Danger.
lines.changingText: Carelessness leads to loss of support and shelter. Be more vigilant.

lines.baseText: The wanderer rests in a shelter. He obtains his property and an ax. My heart is not glad.
lines.changingText: You have security, but you feel defensive and unhappy. Something is missing.

lines.baseText: He shoots a pheasant. It drops with the first arrow. In the end this leads to praise and office.
lines.changingText: Skill and timing bring success. You reach your goal.

lines.baseText: The bird's nest burns up. The wanderer laughs at first, then must needs lament and weep. Through carelessness he loses his cow. Misfortune.
lines.changingText: Arrogance leads to the loss of your resting place. Humility is essential for the wanderer.

hexagrams.name: The Gentle (The Penetrating, Wind) (Xun)
hexagrams.judgment: The Gentle. Success through what is small. It furthers one to have somewhere to go. It furthers one to see the great man.
hexagrams.image: Winds following one upon the other: The image of The Gentle. Thus the superior man spreads his commands abroad and carries out his undertakings.

lines.baseText: In advancing and in retreating, the perseverance of a warrior furthers.
lines.changingText: Indecision is weak. Be decisive like a warrior once you have chosen a path.

lines.baseText: Penetration under the bed. Priests and magicians are used in great number. Good fortune. No blame.
lines.changingText: Revealing hidden things requires special effort. Seek expert guidance.

lines.baseText: Repeated penetration. Humiliation.
lines.changingText: Excessive probing or overthinking leads to paralysis and shame. Act.

lines.baseText: Remorse disappears. During the hunt three kinds of game are caught.
lines.changingText: Success comes from persistent, gentle effort. You achieve multiple goals.

lines.baseText: Perseverance brings good fortune. Remorse disappears. Nothing that does not further. No beginning, but an end. Before the change, three days. After the change, three days. Good fortune.
lines.changingText: Consistent effort pays off. Prepare well for changes and follow through.

lines.baseText: Penetration under the bed. He loses his property and his ax. Perseverance brings misfortune.
lines.changingText: Digging too deep uncovers things best left hidden. You lose your means of defense.

hexagrams.name: The Joyous, Lake (Dui)
hexagrams.judgment: The Joyous. Success. Perseverance furthers.
hexagrams.image: Lakes resting one on the other: The image of The Joyous. Thus the superior man joins with his friends for discussion and practice.

lines.baseText: Contented joyousness. Good fortune.
lines.changingText: Self-contained joy that needs nothing from outside is true happiness.

lines.baseText: Sincere joyousness. Good fortune. Remorse disappears.
lines.changingText: Joy shared with sincerity is deep and lasting. No regrets.

lines.baseText: Coming joyousness. Misfortune.
lines.changingText: Seeking joy from external sources leads to disappointment and dependency.

lines.baseText: Joyousness that is weighed is not at peace. After ridding oneself of mistakes a man has joy.
lines.changingText: Calculating joy kills it. Let go of doubts and simply enjoy.

lines.baseText: Sincerity toward disintegrating influences. Danger.
lines.changingText: Being too trusting of negative people puts you at risk. Guard your heart.

lines.baseText: Seductive joyousness.
lines.changingText: Beware of false pleasures that lead you astray. Stay grounded.

hexagrams.name: Dispersion (Dissolution) (Huan)
hexagrams.judgment: Dispersion. Success. The king approaches his temple. It furthers one to cross the great water. Perseverance furthers.
hexagrams.image: The wind drives over the water: The image of Dispersion. Thus the kings of old sacrificed to the Lord and established temples.

lines.baseText: He brings help with the strength of a horse. Good fortune.
lines.changingText: Immediate action prevents dispersion. Strength saves the day.

lines.baseText: At the dissolution he hurries to that which supports him. Remorse disappears.
lines.changingText: When things fall apart, run to your source of security.

lines.baseText: He dissolves his self. No remorse.
lines.changingText: Letting go of the ego allows for a higher union. Selflessness brings peace.

lines.baseText: He dissolves his bond with his group. Supreme good fortune. Dispersion leads to accumulation. This is something that ordinary men do not think of.
lines.changingText: Leaving the small group allows you to join the universal. A higher perspective.

lines.baseText: His loud cries are as dissolving as sweat. Dissolution! A king abides without blame.
lines.changingText: A powerful release of tension clears the air. The leader remains steady.

lines.baseText: He dissolves his blood. Departing, keeping at a distance, going out, is without blame.
lines.changingText: Avoiding bloodshed by keeping distance is the path of wisdom.

hexagrams.name: Limitation (Jie)
hexagrams.judgment: Limitation. Success. Galling limitation must not be persevered in.
hexagrams.image: Water over the lake: The image of Limitation. Thus the superior man creates number and measure, and examines the nature of virtue and correct conduct.

lines.baseText: Not going out of the door and the courtyard is without blame.
lines.changingText: Knowing when to stay within limits prevents error. Discretion is valor.

lines.baseText: Not going out of the gate and the courtyard brings misfortune.
lines.changingText: Staying inside when it is time to act leads to missed opportunities.

lines.baseText: He who knows no limitation will have cause to lament. No blame.
lines.changingText: Extravagance leads to regret. Accept necessary boundaries.

lines.baseText: Contented limitation. Success.
lines.changingText: Accepting limits with grace brings peace and success.

lines.baseText: Sweet limitation brings good fortune. Going brings esteem.
lines.changingText: Self-discipline that comes from understanding is easy and rewarding.

lines.baseText: Galling limitation. Perseverance brings misfortune. Remorse disappears.
lines.changingText: Limits that are too strict cause rebellion. Relax the rules slightly.

hexagrams.name: Inner Truth (Zhong Fu)
hexagrams.judgment: Inner Truth. Pigs and fishes. Good fortune. It furthers one to cross the great water. Perseverance furthers.
hexagrams.image: Wind over lake: The image of Inner Truth. Thus the superior man discusses criminal cases in order to delay executions.

lines.baseText: Being prepared brings good fortune. If there are secret designs, it is disquieting.
lines.changingText: Inner stability and preparedness attract good fortune. Hidden agendas fail.

lines.baseText: A crane calling in the shade. Its young answers it. I have a good goblet. I will share it with you.
lines.changingText: True resonance connects sympathetic souls across any distance.

lines.baseText: He finds a comrade. Now he beats the drum, now he stops. Now he sobs, now he sings.
lines.changingText: Emotional dependency creates instability. Find your own center.

lines.baseText: The moon nearly full. The team horse goes astray. No blame.
lines.changingText: Humility allows the light to shine through. Let go of the lesser guide.

lines.baseText: He possesses truth, which links together. No blame.
lines.changingText: Universal truth connects everyone. Unity is achieved through shared integrity.

lines.baseText: Cockcrow penetrating to heaven. Perseverance brings misfortune.
lines.changingText: Empty words reach high but have no substance. Silence is better.

hexagrams.name: Preponderance of the Small (Xiao Guo)
hexagrams.judgment: Preponderance of the Small. Success. Perseverance furthers. Small things may be done; great things should not be done. The flying bird brings the message: It is not well to strive upward, it is well to remain below. Great good fortune.
hexagrams.image: Thunder on the mountain: The image of Preponderance of the Small. Thus the superior man in his conduct gives preponderance to reverence. In bereavement he gives preponderance to grief. In his expenditures he gives preponderance to thrift.

lines.baseText: The bird meets with misfortune through flying.
lines.changingText: Trying to do too much too soon leads to failure. Stay low.

lines.baseText: She passes by her ancestor and meets her ancestress. He does not reach his prince and meets the official. No blame.
lines.changingText: Aim for the attainable. Bypassing protocol leads to better results here.

lines.baseText: If one is not extremely careful, somebody may come up from behind and strike him. Misfortune.
lines.changingText: Vulnerability invites attack. Thorough precautions are necessary.

lines.baseText: No blame. He meets him without passing by. Going brings danger. One must be on guard. Do not act. Be persevering.
lines.changingText: Restraint is required. Do not force an encounter. Wait.

lines.baseText: Dense clouds, no rain from our western territory. The prince shoots and hits him who is in the cave.
lines.changingText: Success comes from targeting the hidden problem. Aim true.

lines.baseText: He passes him by, not meeting him. The flying bird leaves him. Misfortune. This means bad luck and injury.
lines.changingText: Arrogance leads to overshooting the mark. Disaster follows.

hexagrams.name: After Completion (Ji Ji)
hexagrams.judgment: After Completion. Success in small matters. Perseverance furthers. At the beginning good fortune, at the end disorder.
hexagrams.image: Water over fire: The image of After Completion. Thus the superior man takes thought of misfortune and arms himself against it in advance.

lines.baseText: He brakes his wheels. He gets his tail in the water. No blame.
lines.changingText: Caution at the moment of success prevents reversal. Stop before you go too far.

lines.baseText: The woman loses the curtain of her carriage. Do not run after it; on the seventh day you will get it.
lines.changingText: Losses now will be restored. Have patience and do not chase after what is gone.

lines.baseText: The Illustrious Ancestor disciplines the Devil's Country. After three years he conquers it. Inferior people must not be employed.
lines.changingText: Long, hard struggle leads to victory. Do not rely on unreliable people.

lines.baseText: The finest clothes turn to rags. Be careful all day long.
lines.changingText: Success is fragile. Constant vigilance is needed to maintain it.

lines.baseText: The neighbor in the east who slaughters an ox does not attain as much real happiness as the neighbor in the west with his small offering.
lines.changingText: Sincerity is worth more than lavish display. Humble success is better.

lines.baseText: He gets his head in the water. Danger.
lines.changingText: Overconfidence leads to drowning in your own success. Know your limits.

hexagrams.name: Before Completion (Wei Ji)
hexagrams.judgment: Before Completion. Success. But if the little fox, after nearly completing the crossing, gets his tail in the water, there is nothing that would further.
hexagrams.image: Fire over water: The image of Before Completion. Thus the superior man is careful in the differentiation of things so that each finds its place.

lines.baseText: He gets his tail in the water. Humiliating.
lines.changingText: Rushing at the start leads to failure. Pace yourself.

lines.baseText: He brakes his wheels. Perseverance brings good fortune.
lines.changingText: Holding back strength for the right moment brings success.

lines.baseText: Before completion, attack brings misfortune. It furthers one to cross the great water.
lines.changingText: The time is not yet ripe for the final push. Wait for favorable conditions.

lines.baseText: Perseverance brings good fortune. Remorse disappears. Shock, thus to discipline the Devil's Country. For three years, great realms are rewarded.
lines.changingText: Persistent effort overcomes resistance and leads to great rewards.

lines.baseText: Perseverance brings good fortune. No remorse. The light of the superior man is true. Good fortune.
lines.changingText: Inner truth shines through and brings success. Trust your light.

lines.baseText: There is drinking of wine in genuine confidence. No blame. But if one wets his head, he loses it, in truth.
lines.changingText: Celebrate success, but do not lose control. Excess leads to loss.
